titles.title: A bill to extend the effective date for the sunset for collateral requirements for Small Business Administration disaster loans.
A bill to extend the effective date for the sunset for collateral requirements for Small Business Administration disaster loans.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.

calendar.text: Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship. Reported by Senator Risch without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 631.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Chabot asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
By Senator Risch from Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship filed written report. Report No. 115-453.

bill.summary: (Sec. 1) This bill amends the RISE After Disaster Act of 2015 to extend by one year the increased threshold for the minimum major-disaster loan amount for which the Small Business Administration may require collateral.
